verses.t: Bow down{H5186} thine ear{H241}, LordO {H3068}, hear{H6030} me: for I am poor{H6041} and needy{H34}.A Prayerâ€¦: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of David
Preserve{H8104} my soul{H5315}; for I am holy{H2623}: O thou my God{H430}, save{H3467} thy servant{H5650} that trusteth{H982} in thee.holy: or, one whom thou favourest
Be merciful{H2603} unto me, O Lord{H136}: for I cry{H7121} unto thee daily{H3117}.daily: or, all the day
Rejoice{H8055} the soul{H5315} of thy servant{H5650}: for unto thee, O Lord{H136}, do I lift up{H5375} my soul{H5315}.
For thou, Lord{H136}, art good{H2896}, and ready to forgive{H5546}; and plenteous{H7227} in mercy{H2617} unto all them that call{H7121} upon thee.
Give ear{H238}, LordO {H3068}, unto my prayer{H8605}; and attend{H7181} to the voice{H6963} of my supplications{H8469}.
In the day{H3117} of my trouble{H6869} I will call{H7121} upon thee: for thou wilt answer{H6030} me.
Among the gods{H430} there is none like unto thee, O Lord{H136}; neither are there any works like unto thy works{H4639}.
All nations{H1471} whom thou hast made{H6213}shall come{H935} and worship{H7812} before{H6440} thee, O Lord{H136}; and shall glorify{H3513} thy name{H8034}.
For thou art great{H1419}, and doest{H6213} wondrous things{H6381}: thou art God{H430} alone.
Teach{H3384} me thy way{H1870}, LordO {H3068}; I will walk{H1980} in thy truth{H571}: unite{H3161} my heart{H3824} to fear{H3372} thy name{H8034}.
I will praise{H3034} thee, O Lord{H136} my God{H430}, with all my heart{H3824}: and I will glorify{H3513} thy name{H8034} for evermore{H5769}.
For great{H1419} is thy mercy{H2617} toward me: and thou hast delivered{H5337} my soul{H5315} from the lowest{H8482} hell{H7585}.hell: or, grave

O God{H430}, the proud{H2086} are risen{H6965} against me, and the assemblies{H5712} of violent{H6184} men have sought{H1245} after my soul{H5315}; and have not set{H7760} thee before them.violent: Heb. terrible
But thou, O Lord{H136}, art a God{H410} full of compassion{H7349}, and gracious{H2587}, longsuffering{H639}, and plenteous{H7227} in mercy{H2617} and truth{H571}.
O turn{H6437} unto me, and have mercy{H2603} upon me; give{H5414} thy strength{H5797} unto thy servant{H5650}, and save{H3467} the son{H1121} of thine handmaid{H519}.
Shew{H6213} me a token{H226} for good{H2896}; that they which hate{H8130} me may see{H7200} it, and be ashamed{H954}: Lordbecause thou, {H3068}, hast holpen{H5826} me, and comforted{H5162} me.
